poker

Class AutomatedPokerPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • poker.PokerPlayer
      • poker.AutomatedPokerPlayer

  • public class AutomatedPokerPlayer
extends PokerPlayer
    An subclass of PokerPlayer that forms an AI player capable of deciding its actions with influence of an acquired nature.
    Author:
    Dara Callinan, Jazheel Luna, Eoghan O'Donnell, Crischelle Pana

    • Constructor Detail

      • AutomatedPokerPlayer

        AutomatedPokerPlayer(java.lang.String name,
                     DeckOfCards deck)
        Class constructor. Calls the PokerPlayer constructor and generates a random personality for the player.
        Parameters:
        name - The String containing the player's name.
        deck - The deck of cards being used to deal the player's hand.
        See Also:
        generatePersonality

    • Method Detail

      • handBetValue

        private int handBetValue(int blind)
        Determines a betting value for a player's hand. First, the hand is given a value in terms of how many big blinds/antes it is worth, then that value is multiplied by the blind value in chips.
        Parameters:
        blind - The big blind.
        Returns:
        An int representing the betting value for the hand.

      • getBettingChips

        private int getBettingChips(int toCall,
                            int minimumBet,
                            int blind,
                            int betMult)
        Gets the amount of chips the player is willing to bet in addition to the amount they need to call. The final amount is based on a bet multiplier and the minimum bet. The number is then influenced by a random value in the range of the player's lowerBetModifier and upperBetModifier. The player will attempt to conserve chips if they are nearing bankruptcy, so they can pay blinds for future rounds if necessary.
        Parameters:
        toCall - The amount needed for the player to call the current bet.
        minimumBet - The minimum amount that can be bet or raised.
        blind - The big blind.
        betMult - The minimum bet multiplier to generate a base value.
        Returns:
        The amount of chips to be bet.

      • decideBetValue

        private int decideBetValue(int toCall,
                           int handVal,
                           int betAmount,
                           int minimumBet,
                           int blind)
        Generates a value to bet or raise by if playing a good hand. Depending on the hand value and the nature of the player, the player can bet varying amounts to greaten the pot or fold players, bluff a low value hand by calling or checking, or try to steal the pot with a very large bet.
        Parameters:
        toCall - The amount of chips needed to call the current bet.
        handVal - The value of the player's hand.
        betAmount - The current total bet amount.
        minimumBet - The minimum amount of chips that can be bet or raised.
        blind - The big blind.
        Returns:
        The amount to bet.

      • action

        int action(int betAmount,
           int minimumBet,
           int blind)
        Description copied from class: PokerPlayer
        Decides the player's action in a round of poker round of betting.
        Specified by:
        action in class PokerPlayer
        Parameters:
        betAmount - The total amount necessary to call.
        minimumBet - The minimum amount that can be bet or raised.
        blind - The big blind for the game.
        Returns:
        The amount of chips added to the pot.

      • discard

        int discard()
        Description copied from class: PokerPlayer
        Decides which cards the player should discard during the discard phase of a round of poker.
        Specified by:
        discard in class PokerPlayer
        Returns:
        The amount of cards discarded by the player.

      • generatePersonality

        void generatePersonality(int t)
        Generates one preset personality for this player by assigning the nature attributes. The preset personalities range from very safe players to very aggressive and bluffing players.
        Parameters:
        t - The int to determine the personality.
        See Also:
        chance to bluff, lower limit for discarding, amount of big blinds the player tries to preserve, the upper limit for betting, the lower limit for betting
